keyMoments.title: Spandam's First Appearance
keyMoments.description: Spandam, a CP5 agent, arrives at Water 7 eight years before the present timeline. He meets with Tom, claiming he has researched Water 7's history extensively and is seeking the Pluton blueprints.
keyMoments.significance: Introduces the main antagonist responsible for Tom's downfall and the conspiracy that shaped Franky and Iceburg's lives.
keyMoments.quote: I've been researching the history of Water 7 for a long time.

keyMoments.title: Receives Orders from Five Elders
keyMoments.description: Flashback reveals that Spandam received direct orders from the Five Elders to obtain the Pluton blueprints under the guise of combating piracy.
keyMoments.significance: Establishes Spandam's high-level authorization and the World Government's interest in ancient weapons.

keyMoments.title: Begins Conspiracy to Frame Tom
keyMoments.description: Unable to obtain the blueprints legally, Spandam plots to frame Tom by using Franky's Battle Franky ships to attack government vessels.
keyMoments.significance: Sets in motion the tragic events that lead to Tom's execution and Franky's transformation.

affiliations.note: Leads Cipher Pol No. 5 during this time period
Works directly under orders from the Five Elders

relationships.description: Spandam reports to and receives orders from the Five Elders regarding ancient weapon recovery.

evolutionMoments.description: Receives authorization from Five Elders to pursue Pluton blueprints

relationships.description: Spandam targets Tom to obtain the Pluton blueprints, eventually framing him for attacking government ships.

evolutionMoments.description: Spandam meets Tom and begins plotting against him

reveals.information: Chief of CP5, World Government intelligence agency
Seeks to obtain Pluton blueprints for personal power
Works under direct orders from the Five Elders

keyMoments.title: Sea Train Completion Celebrated
keyMoments.description: Eight years before the present, Water 7 celebrates the successful completion of Tom's Sea Train, the Puffing Tom. This achievement was meant to earn Tom a pardon for building Gol D. Roger's ship.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Tom's greatest achievement and the redemption he earned through his work.

keyMoments.title: Reveals Pluton Blueprints to Apprentices
keyMoments.description: Tom retrieves the Pluton blueprints from a hidden safe and shows them to Iceburg and Franky, warning that it would be a nightmare if the ancient weapon were ever built.
keyMoments.significance: Central reveal of the arc's MacGuffin and demonstrates Tom's wisdom in recognizing the danger.
keyMoments.quote: It would be a nightmare if Pluton is built.

keyMoments.title: Entrusts Pluton Blueprints to Iceburg
keyMoments.description: Tom decides he can no longer keep the blueprints safe and entrusts them to Iceburg, who agrees to take responsibility. Franky's suggestion to build it is immediately rejected.
keyMoments.significance: Critical decision that determines Iceburg's future and makes him a target for CP9.
keyMoments.quote: I cannot keep the blueprints anymore.

keyMoments.title: Tom's Shipbuilding Philosophy Revealed
keyMoments.description: The episode reveals Tom's core philosophy - that a shipwright should take pride in their ships regardless of how they're used, and his pride in building the Oro Jackson.
keyMoments.significance: Establishes the philosophical foundation that will later define Franky's character.

statusHistory.reason: Alive in flashbacks during this period

affiliations.note: Founded and led Tom's Workers shipbuilding company

abilities.description: Known as the best shipwright in the world, capable of building legendary ships like the Oro Jackson and the Sea Train.

relationships.description: Tom is Iceburg's master, teaching him shipbuilding and entrusting him with the Pluton blueprints.

evolutionMoments.description: Tom entrusts the Pluton blueprints to Iceburg, showing his complete trust

relationships.description: Tom is Franky's master and father figure, teaching him shipbuilding and life lessons.

evolutionMoments.description: Tom shows Franky the Pluton blueprints and his philosophy about taking pride in one's work

relationships.description: Spandam targets Tom to obtain the Pluton blueprints.

evolutionMoments.description: Spandam meets Tom and begins plotting to frame him

reveals.information: Tom possessed the blueprints for the ancient weapon Pluton
Believes shipwrights should take pride in their ships regardless of their use
Deeply fears what would happen if Pluton were ever built

keyMoments.title: Young Iceburg During Sea Train Celebration
keyMoments.description: Eight years in the past, Iceburg is shown as Tom's apprentice during the Sea Train celebration. He informs Kokoro that Tom is meeting with a World Government agent.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Iceburg's role as the more serious and responsible apprentice.

keyMoments.title: Accepts Custody of Pluton Blueprints
keyMoments.description: Iceburg agrees to take responsibility for guarding the Pluton blueprints from Tom. When Franky suggests building it, Iceburg immediately punches him and declares it should never be built.
keyMoments.significance: This decision shapes Iceburg's entire future and makes him the target of CP9's assassination attempt in the present timeline.

affiliations.note: Apprentice to Tom eight years before present timeline
Founded Galley-La Company after Tom's Workers disbanded

relationships.description: Tom is Iceburg's master and mentor in shipbuilding.

evolutionMoments.description: Tom entrusts Iceburg with the Pluton blueprints

relationships.description: Fellow apprentice under Tom, though Iceburg is more serious and responsible.

evolutionMoments.description: Iceburg punches Franky for suggesting they build Pluton

reveals.information: Became guardian of the Pluton blueprints after Tom entrusted them to him
More serious and responsible than Franky, immediately understanding the danger of ancient weapons

keyMoments.title: Confronted by Lucci at Franky House
keyMoments.description: In the present timeline, Rob Lucci arrives at Franky's base and demands the Pluton blueprints. Franky orders him to leave.
keyMoments.significance: Confirms that Franky now possesses the Pluton blueprints and sets up the upcoming conflict.

keyMoments.title: First Sees Pluton Blueprints
keyMoments.description: Eight years in the past, young Franky sees the Pluton blueprints for the first time when Tom reveals them. He is shocked by their existence.
keyMoments.significance: First exposure to the blueprints that will define much of Franky's future.

keyMoments.title: Suggests Building Pluton (Punched by Iceburg)
keyMoments.description: Young Franky impulsively expresses interest in actually building Pluton, showing his reckless nature. Iceburg immediately punches him and rejects the idea.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Franky's impulsive nature before Tom's teachings fully shape his character.

keyMoments.title: Learns Tom's Philosophy
keyMoments.description: Franky witnesses Tom's philosophy about taking pride in one's ships regardless of their use, a lesson that will later become central to his character.
keyMoments.significance: Establishes the philosophical foundation that defines Franky's approach to shipbuilding.

affiliations.note: Apprentice to Tom eight years before present timeline
Leads the Franky Family in present timeline

relationships.description: Tom is Franky's master and father figure.

evolutionMoments.description: Tom shows Franky the Pluton blueprints and shares his philosophy

relationships.description: Fellow apprentice under Tom, though more reckless and impulsive.

evolutionMoments.description: Gets punched by Iceburg for suggesting they build Pluton

relationships.description: Lucci targets Franky to obtain the Pluton blueprints.

evolutionMoments.description: Lucci confronts Franky at Franky House demanding the blueprints

reveals.information: Currently possesses the Pluton blueprints (confirmed by Lucci's demand)
Built battleships called Battle Frankys that Spandam will use to frame Tom
Was more reckless and impulsive as a youth, not fully understanding consequences
